content: marlion by fiona kelly felted crochet amigurumi lion materials 340g of kauni effectgarten eq rainbow pure wool 4ply / fingering weight yarn or similar feltable yarn 2 x oddments of white pure wool yarn 2 x oddments of black pure wool yarn polyfill or similar stuffing 1 x 5mm usa h crochet hook 1 x amigurumi stitch/row marker a sharp pair of sciccors 1 x reel of sewing thread in medium grey & sharp sewing needle 1 x darning needle optional few handfuls of plastic pellet filling n b plastic pellet filling is not to be used if toy is being made for small child due to nature of small parts size seated height to top of head not including mane is around 27 5cms 11 inches page 1 copyright © 2008 fiona kelly make for yourself but do not sell do not copy and distribute or sell this pattern thanks for respecting copyright any queries email me at creative textiles@btinternet com & see more of my designs at http //fionakelly wordpress com/ a few important notes before you start this pattern is designed to be felted after crocheting so you must use a feltable yarn ideally use any hand wash 100% pure wool shetlandwool or lamsbswool or 100% pure angora angora/wool mix 100% pure cashmere or cashmere/wool mix yarn you can use 100% pure alpaca or alpaca/wool mixes but they do not felt as sucessfully pure or mixture yarns containing cotton silk linen acrylic any other yarns that are synthetic or machine washable will not felt if you are not sure whether your yarn will felt i recommend you test it by crocheting a small 20dc x 20row swatch & machine wash at 60 degrees with your next load of washing put a dye catching sheet in the wash if you re doing whites and your swatch isn t if your swatch shrinks & matts it has definitely felted in some way & the more it shrinks the better the resulting felted fabric also when you crochet this amigurumi lion the gauge will be quite loose/open this is unusual for amigurumi but absolutely correct for this pattern so do not change to a smaller hook the slightly open texture of the fabric is needed to help the felting process happen properly and make it a really soft and fuzzy texture lastly as with all amigurumi patterns this lion is worked in continuous rounds with no slip stitches between rounds gauge n b felted gauge will vary according to the yarn & temperature during washing cycle used before felting 17dc x 28rows to 10cm & after felting roughly 30dc x 51rows to 10cm over plain double_crochet fabric mane chain loops are about 13cms long when stretched out before felting & about 7cms long after felting
